title: Week In 2016 Politics Focuses On Bush, Clinton Money Issues
teaser: Hillary Clinton is being asked about Clinton Foundation donors, and Jeb Bush is pushing the envelope of campaign finance rules.
contentencoded:
Hillary Clinton is under growing pressure to answer questions about the Clinton Foundation’s acceptance of money from foreign donors.

Jeb Bush is pushing the envelope of campaign finance rules by outsourcing many traditional campaign functions to his super PAC Right to Rise, which cannot legally coordinate its actions with a Bush presidential campaign. Bush has not yet announced he’s running for president.

Tom Beaumont of the Associated Press discusses the latest in 2016 politics with Here & Now’s Robin Young.

  • See more in our weekly series about the race for 2016

Guest

  • Thomas Beaumont, politics writer for the Associated Press, based in Iowa. He tweets @TomBeaumont.
